personal.question: When did Elvis die?
personal.answer: Elvis Presley passed away due to heart failure August 16, 1977, at Graceland in Memphis, Tennessee. He was 42 years old.

personal.question: What year did Elvis graduate high school?
When did Elvis get his first guitar?
personal.answer: He received one purchased from Tupelo Hardware Company on January 8, 1946 - his 11th birthday.

personal.question: When did the Presley family move to Memphis?
Before becoming famous, what was Elvis' job?
personal.answer: He drove a delivery truck for the Memphis company, Crown Electric.

personal.question: What year is the pink Cadillac in the Elvis Presley car museum?
Where was the first house Elvis purchased?
Who did Elvis buy Graceland from?
personal.answer: Mrs. Ruth Brown Moore, former wife of Dr. Thomas Moore

career.q: When did Elvis record his first record at Sun Studio?
career.a: He recorded 'That's All Right' on July 5, 1954.

career.q: Where was Elvis' first billed show?
career.a: He performed at Overton Park Shell on July 30, 1954.

career.q: On what Saturday radio show did Elvis regularly perform?
For what product did Elvis make his only commercial?
career.a: Southern Made Doughnuts radio jingle while on the Louisiana Hayride.

career.q: What was Elvis' first gold record?
On what show was Elvis' first national TV appearance?
career.a: Tommy and Jimmy Dorsey Stage Show on January 28, 1956.

career.q: How many movies did Elvis make?
Name the only three cities outside of the US where Elvis performed?
How many grammy awards did Elvis recieve in his lifetime?
career.a: Three Grammys - all for his Gospel music.

career.q: How many records is it estimated that Elvis sold worldwide?

career.a: Market Square Arena, Indianapolis, IN on June 26, 1977

family.an: Elvis Presley's wife was Priscilla (Beaulieu) Presley.

family.qu: At what hotel in Las Vegas were Elvis and Priscilla married?

family.an: Lisa Marie Presley was born on February 1, 1968 at Baptist Memorial Hospital in Memphis, Tennessee.
